title: Connecting Rod Big End Journal Checking, Measuring and Bearing Selection

body.body: Connecting Rod Big End Journal Checking, Measuring and Bearing Selection

The use of selective bearings compensates for minor differences in crankshaft big end bearing journal diameter. For more information about bearing part number to diameter cross-references, refer to the electronic parts catalogue EPC.
Measure the bearing and crankshaft journal clearance as follows:
Do not turn the connecting rod and crankshaft during the clearance measurement as this will damage the Plastigauge. The crankshaft journal clearances are measured using
Remove the big end cap from the journal.
Wipe the exposed areas of the crankshaft journal, and the bearing face inside the cap.
Apply a thin smear of grease to the journal and a small quantity of silicone release agent to the bearing.
Trim a length of the Plastigauge to fit across the journal. Fit the strip to the journal using the grease to hold the Plastigauge in place.
The original fixings may be reused for bearing selection.
Do not use new fixings as they can only be used once, even if the single use is related to bearing selection.
If the clearance exceeds the service limit, measure the diameter of the crankshaft bearing journal.
If any journal has worn beyond the service limit, the crankshaft must be replaced.
Due to the advanced techniques used during manufacture, the crankshaft cannot be reground and no oversize bearings are available.
If the measured clearance exceeds the service limit, measure the crankshaft journal diameter.
Minor differences in dimensions are compensated for by using selective bearings. For further information on bearing part number to colour cross-references, see the latest parts information.
Select the correct bearing shell as follows:
Measure and record the diameter of the crankshaft bearing journal.
Measure and record the bearing bore diameter (bearings removed, journal cap fitted and the fixings torqued, see
Select the correct bearings by matching the information found in the bearing selection chart.
Always use the Plastigauge method to confirm that the running clearance is correct before final assembly.
Severe engine damage could result from incorrect bearing clearance.
This could leading to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
